materials: Red Heart® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 913 Calliope A, 320 Cornmeal B, 706 Perfect Pink C, 885 Delft Blue D, 505 Aruba Sea E, 530 Orchid F and 624 Tea Leaf G
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: Size 3.75mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: 5 sts = 1” [2 ½ cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specific gauge.
gauge: 5 sts = 1” [2 ½ cm]
instructions:
Ears (make 2)
With C, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 chs, hdc in next 2 chs, sc in next ch, 3 sc in next ch, working in remaining loops on opposite side of ch, sc in next ch, hdc in next 2 chs, sc in next 3 sts, slip st in first st. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, attach each ear to top of Bunny head.

Eyes (make 2)
Cut 2 circles each of black and pink felt. Position black felt slightly off-center over top of pink felt. Glue black felt in place. Glue each assembled Eye to Bunny head.

Nose
Cut out a small triangle of pink felt. Center below Eyes and glue to Bunny head.

FLOWERS
Small Flower (Make 5 each with B, C, D, E and F)
Center
Ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first st. Fasten off.

Petals
Round 1: Join different color yarn to any st on Center, ch 1, (sc, ch 3, dc, ch 3, sc) in same st as join, *(sc, ch 3, dc, ch 3, sc) in next st, repeat from * 4 times. Fasten off, leaving an 8” [20 cm] tail. Use tail to sew Flowers to wrapped Eggs. Weave tail in back of Flower.

Large Flower (make 5 each with B, C, D, E and F)
Center
Ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first st. Fasten off.

PROJECT NOTES
For easier wrapping, make 3” [7.6 cm] balls of yarn of each color for the Styrofoam eggs and a 4” [10 cm] ball of yarn for the wreath. If using a straw wreath, leave the plastic wrap on the wreath for easier wrapping.

WREATH
With A, evenly wrap yarn around the entire wreath. Weave in a 3” [7.6 cm] tail on the back.

Eggs
Wrap 5 eggs with colors B, C, D, E and F. Tightly wrap the eggs vertically around until the Styrofoam is covered. Weave in a 3” [7.6 cm] tail on the back of the egg. When the wrapping is done, to keep yarn in place at the top and bottom of the egg, add a very small amount of white glue under the top strands of yarn.

Wreath Assembly
Insert a stem wire through the back of each egg vertically. Attach the eggs to the wreath off center, in a row, with the stem wire by winding the stem wire around the wreath and twist tightly on the back to secure. Trim the wire and poke the loose ends into the wreath. Add some white glue under the eggs to secure them in place to the wreath.

Bunny
With A, make a 1” [2.5 cm] pompom for the head and 2” [5 cm] pompom for the body. Tie the head to the body.

Ruffle Collar
With G, ch loosely to fit around neck of Bunny. Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook, *3 dc in next ch, rep from * across. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, tie Ruffle Collar around Neck of Bunny and trim.

Petals
Round 1: Join different color yarn to any st on Center, ch 1, sc in same st as join, *ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 3 chs, sc in next st on Center, repeat from * 4 times, ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 3 chs, slip st in first st. Fasten off, leaving an 8” [20 cm] tail. Using tail, sew flowers to wrapped Eggs. Weave tail in back of flower.

LEAVES
With G, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, 3 sc in next ch, working in rem loops on opposite side of ch, hdc in first ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next 2 chs, sl st in first st. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, sew 1 Leaf to back of each Flower. Weave in loose ends.

FINISHING
Before attaching the flowers, pin the flowers in place arranging different sizes and colors. This will allow you to decide what sizes, colors go well together. Once you have decided on your design take a digital picture for reference.

Attach the flowers by sewing the back of the flower to the yarn wrapped on the eggs and wreath. Add a small amount of white glue to hold in place. Trim and weave in loose yarn.

Hanging Loop
With 2 strands A, ch 80, slip st in 80th ch from hook. Wrap the connected chain around the wreath and pull the front end through back end of the circle to make a hanging loop.

Bunny Attachment
Attach Bunny to the wreath, behind the eggs by threading a stem wire through the body and then wrapping the stem wire around the wreath securely. Trim the excess wire and poke into the wreath.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Blush (32027) 1 ball or 16 yds/15 m per Wreath
Contrast B Velveteal (32005) 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m per Wreath
Contrast C Smokey Green (32025) 1 ball or 14 yds/13 m per Wreath
Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m) Contrast D Navy (07711) 1 ball or 3 yds/3 m per Wreath
Note: 1 ball each of A, B, C and D makes 19 Wreaths.
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
One 6" [15 cm] metal craft ring per Wreath.
One 6" x 8" [15 x 20.5 cm] piece of felt per Wreath.
Hot glue gun and glue sticks.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS)
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: 15 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Flower = 4" [10 cm] diameter. Leaf = 2½" [6 cm] long.
instructions:
FLOWER
Petal Rounds (make 2) See diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
1st row: (WS). Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Working back down ch-6 toward ch-10 ring, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Sl st in next ch of ch-10 ring. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Working back down opposite side of last ch-6 toward ch-10 ring, 2 sc in next rem loop. 1 dc in each of next 4 rem loop. Ch 3. Sl st in same rem loop as last dc. Sl st in each of next 2 ch of ch-10 ring. Turn.
Last 2 rows form one Petal.
Rep 1st and 2nd rows 4 times more to complete 4 more Petals (total of 5 Petals), ending with sl st in same rem loop as last dc.
Fasten off.
Center
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc of rnd. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 2 Lp sts in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st of rnd. 10 Lp sts.
Fasten off. Cut the center of each loop to create 2 strands of yarn per loop.
Flower Finishing: Place two Petal Rounds RS up, aligning Ch-10 rings and offsetting Petals. Place Center RS up on top of Petal Rounds and sew all three pieces together to form Flower (as shown in photo).
Leaf (Make 3 each with B and C).
Ch 5. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: (5 tr. Ch 1. 5 tr) all in 5th ch from hook (counts as ch 4. 5 tr. Ch 1. 5 tr). Ch 4. Sl st in same 5th ch from hook.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in first ch-4 sp (working around first ch-4 along bottom edge of Leaf). 1 sc in next tr. 2 sc in next tr. 2 hdc in next tr. 2 dc in next tr. 1 dc in next tr. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next tr. 2 dc in next tr. 2 hdc in next tr. 2 sc in next tr. 1 sc in last tr. 5 sc in next ch-4 sp (working around last ch-4 along bottom edge of Leaf). Join with sl st in first ch-1. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attaching Flower and Leaves to Craft Ring: Tie Flower and Leaves to metal craft ring as shown in photo. Center piece of felt behind metal craft ring, Flower, and Leaves. Using hot glue gun and glue sticks, glue WS of Flowers and Leaves in place along metal craft ring at the same time also gluing them to felt piece to secure in place and create a sturdy backing for the decorations. Trim edges of felt close to Flower and Leaves so it is hidden behind decorations when viewed from RS (as shown in photo).
Hanging String: Cut strand of B 20" [51 cm] long. Attach with Lark’s Head Knot to top of metal craft ring (as shown in diagram). Tie tail ends together to desired length for hanging and trim ends.
Attach Hanging String with Lark’s Head Knot.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 706 Perfect Pink A, 3946 Razzle B and 400 Grey Heather C
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: 14” (35.5 cm) of each A, B and C yarn
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Perfect for Valentine’s Day decorating or for any romantic occasion, this heart-shaped wreath is a warm expression of love. Display it on your door, in a window or above the mantel. Heart Bunting can also be used separately wherever you please.
FINISHING
Arrow
Insert the dowel through wrapped wreath. Add a small amount of glue in each hole to hold dowel in place. With right side facing out, sew remaining two small hearts together, leaving a small opening at the bottom of the heart to insert dowel.
With right side facing out, sew two large hearts together, leaving a small opening at the top of heart to insert dowel.
Add a small amount of glue to each end of dowel. Insert upper end into opening on joined large hearts. Insert lower end into opening on joined small hearts.
Hanger
Cut 14” (35.5 cm) of each A, B and C yarn. Braid yarn and attach to the top of Styrofoam® heart with straight pins. Weave in loose threads.
Pattern Note
For easier wrapping, make a 2½” (6.4 cm) ball of each color to wrap around wreath.
WREATH
Push dowel rod through the wreath diagonally as shown in photo before wrapping yarn around wreath. Remove dowel rod. Wrap yarn around wreath alternating colors A, B and C. When changing colors, lay a 2” (5 cm) end of the next color next to end of previous color and wrap next color over both ends. This will help keep yarn from unraveling. After wrapping last color, weave in loose ends and trim.
Small Heart (Make 6 with A and 4 with B)
With A or B, ch 2.
Round 1: 9 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (9 sc)
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 4, tr, dc) in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, (dc, tr, ch 4, slip st) in next st. Fasten off. (15 sts)
Bunting
With A, make two chains long enough to drape from right to left side of wreath. Attach the chains with straight pins. Weave in loose ends of yarn.
Alternating colors, sew 4 small hearts to each chain.
Large Heart for Arrow (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (6 sts)
Round 2: 2 sc in next 5 sts, 3 sc in last st. (13 sts)
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 3, 2 tr) in next st, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, (2 tr, ch 3, sl st) in next st. Fasten off. (19 sts)
